context:
Grades were awarded following a different process in 2020 after public exams were cancelled in all constituent countries of the UK.

In Wales, entry numbers in all subjects have been affected by a change in school performance measures. From summer 2019, pupils' first entries, rather than best entries, are counted. This is likely to have had the effect of disincentivising Year 10 entries in 2018.

definition:
In England and Wales, a combined, double award science GCSE replaced science and additional science GCSEs in 2018. This is reported on separately.

Single award science remains available in Northern Ireland.

definition:
Up to 2016, a combined English GCSE was available, covering both English language and English literature. Entry numbers are included here, along with entries in English language GCSE. Since 2017, only separate English language and English literature GCSEs are available.

In England, since 2017, a separate grade is awarded for spoken language. This is graded as pass, merit, distinction or not classified, and the grade awarded does not contribute to an entrant's English language grade.
context:
Grades were awarded following a different process in 2020 after public exams were cancelled in all constituent countries of the UK.

In England, entries in English language increased markedly in 2017 as the alternative IGCSE English language qualification ceased to count in school league tables.

In England, since 2015, pupils who achieved a grade D/3 in English language and who did not achieve higher than a grade D/3 in English literature have been required to resit English language GCSE as part of their post-16 studies, leading to the number of post-16 entries increasing greatly.

In Wales, a reformed English language GCSE was first available in 2017, and would not therefore have been accessible to Year 10 students the previous year. This is believed to have had the effect of inflating the number of Year 11 entries in 2017, with entries returning to a lower level in 2018.

In Wales, entry numbers in all subjects have been affected by a change in school performance measures. From summer 2019, pupils' first entries, rather than best entries, will be counted. This is likely to have had the effect of disincentivising Year 10 entries in 2018.

Grades were awarded following a different process in 2020 after public exams were cancelled in all constituent countries of the UK.

In England, entries in English literature increased markedly in 2017 for two reasons. Firstly, the alternative IGCSE English literature qualification ceased to count in school league tables. Secondly, for the first time in 2017, to count fully in Progress 8, the secondary school accountability measure, pupils had to take separate English language and English literature GCSEs..

In Wales, in 2017, a substantial proportion of pupils had previously entered English literature in Year 10. A move away from this is likely to have increased Year 11 entries in 2018.

In Wales, entry numbers in all subjects have been affected by a change in school performance measures. From summer 2019, pupils' first entries, rather than best entries, will be counted. This is likely to have had the effect of disincentivising Year 10 entries in 2018.

definition: Food preparation and nutrition GCSEs were newly available in England and Wales in 2018. Data is therefore not available for earlier years.

In England, since 2015, pupils who achieved a grade D/grade 3 have been required to resit maths GCSE as part of their post-16 studies. The number of post-16 entries has increased greatly - something masked by a decline in entries by those aged 15 or less when only total (all age) entry numbers are considered.

In Wales, a reformed maths GCSE was first available in 2017, and would not therefore have been accessible to Year 10 students the previous year. This is believed to have had the effect of inflating the number of Year 11 entries in 2017, with entries in 2018 expected to return to a lower level.

In Wales, entry numbers in all subjects have been affected by a change in school performance measures. From summer 2019, pupils' first entries, rather than best entries, will be counted. This is likely to have had the effect of disincentivising Year 10 entries in 2018.

definition:
In England and Wales, a combined, double award science GCSE replaced science and additional science GCSEs in 2018. This is reported on separately.

Single award science remains available in Northern Ireland.
context:
Grades were awarded following a different process in 2020 after public exams were cancelled in all constituent countries of the UK.

In England and Wales, entries in science decreased sharply in 2017 as a result of a large fall in the number of Year 10 entries. The replacement of science and additional science GCSEs with a double award qualification in 2018 means that students who sat science GCSE in 2017 would not be able to sit additional science in 2018. In England, their single award science qualification would also not count in school league tables in 2018.

In Wales, entry numbers in all subjects have been affected by a change in school performance measures. From summer 2019, pupils' first entries, rather than best entries, will be counted. This is likely to have had the effect of disincentivising Year 10 entries in 2018.

definition: In England and Wales, a combined, double award science GCSE replaced science and additional science GCSEs in 2018. Entry numbers are shown doubled. Data is not available for earlier years, as the qualification did not exist.
